title: VPSLLVW/VPSLLVD/VPSLLVQ â€” Variable Bit Shift Left Logical

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VPSLLVD xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPSLLVQ xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPSLLVD ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPSLLVQ ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPSLLVW xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPSLLVW ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPSLLVW zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512`
`VPSLLVD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m32bcst`
`VPSLLVD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m32bcst`
`VPSLLVD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m32bcst`
`VPSLLVQ xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VPSLLVQ ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VPSLLVQ zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Shifts the bits in the individual data elements (words, doublewords or quadword) in the first source operand to the left by the count value of respective data elements in the second source operand. As the bits in the data elements are shifted left, the empty low-order bits are cleared (set to 0).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The count values are specified individually in each data element of the second source operand. If the unsigned integer value specified in the respective data element of the second source operand is greater than 15 (for word), 31 (for doublewords), or 63 (for a quadword), then the destination data element are written with 0.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 encoded version: The destination and first source operands are XMM registers. The count operand can be either an XMM register or a 128-bit memory location. Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: The destination and first source operands are YMM registers. The count operand can be either an YMM register or a 256-bit memory. Bits (MAXVL-1:256) of the corresponding ZMM register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded VPSLLVD/Q: The destination and first source operands are ZMM/YMM/XMM registers. The count operand can be either a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location or a 512-bit vector broadcasted from a 32/64-bit memory location. The destination is conditionally updated with writemask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded VPSLLVW: The destination and first source operands are ZMM/YMM/XMM registers. The count operand can be either a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location. The destination is conditionally updated with writemask k1.
